00047 /* Compilation switches for various Deluge policies and debugging. */
00048 
00049 // Nodes only listen neighbors with their id + or - 1
00050 //#define DELUGE_FORCE_MULTIHOP
00051 
00052 //#define DELUGE_PRINT_PACKETS
00053 //#define DELUGE_PRINT_EVENT
00054 
00055 //#define DELUGE_COMMANDER
00056 
00057 // Store packet counts
00058 //#define DELUGE_KEEP_STATS
00059 
00060 // Transfer data, but don't load and execute it.  Useful for experiments.
00061 #define DELUGE_NO_REPROGRAM
00062 
00063 // Member and forwarding nodes behave the same, forwarding nodes don't reprogram
00064 //#define DELUGE_NO_FORWARD
00065 
00066 #ifndef DELUGE_NO_FORWARD
00067 
00068 // Check for link symmetry before using DTB
00069 #define DELUGE_SYMMETRIC_LINKS
00070 
00071 // Member nodes don't use DTB
00072 #define MEMBER_NO_DTB
00073 
00074 // Forward data packets as soon as they arrive, don't wait for a full page
00075 // This one is stupid, don't bother trying it.
00076 //#define DELUGE_FORWARD_DATA_IMMEDIATELY
00077 
00078 // Handle new requests immediately, don't wait for the next timeout
00079 //#define DELUGE_FORWARD_REQUESTS_IMMEDIATELY
00080 
00081 // Drop outgoing request if we timeout too many times
00082 #define DELUGE_CLEAR_OUTGOING
00083 
00084 // Scale request timeout by DTB
00085 #define DELUGE_DTB_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
00086 //#define DELUGE_DTB_EXP_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
00087 
00088 // Size of cache in pages
00089 #define DELUGE_CACHE_PAGES 10
00090 #endif

00092 /* Deluge parameter constants: */
00093 #define DELUGE_K         1
00094 #define DELUGE_FORWARD_K        4
00095 #define DELUGE_LAMBDA   2
00096 #define DELUGE_T_L      (2*(uint32_t)TICKS_PER_SEC)     // 2 seconds
00097 #define DELUGE_T_H      (256*(uint32_t)TICKS_PER_SEC)   // 256 seconds
00098 #define DELUGE_T_R      ((uint32_t)TICKS_PER_SEC/(uint32_t)2)   // half a second
00099 #define DELUGE_OMEGA    ((uint32_t)8)
00100 // Estimate the time it takes to transmit 1 data packet plus 20 bytes overhead at 9600 bps plus a 10 ms backoff
00101 #define DELUGE_T_TX     ((uint32_t)TICKS_PER_SEC*(uint32_t)84*(uint32_t)8/(uint32_t)9600 + (uint32_t)TICKS_PER_SEC/(uint32_t)100)
00102 #define DELUGE_TX_DELAY_INC     1
00103 #define DELUGE_TX_DELAY_MAX     500
00104 #define DELUGE_TX_DELAY_MIN     0
00105 
00106 //#ifdef DELUGE_SYMMETRIC_LINKS
00107 #define DELUGE_NEIGHBOR_COUNT   5
00108 //#endif

00110 #ifdef DELUGE_COMMANDER
00111 typedef struct {
00112         uint8_t seq;
00113         uint8_t command;
00114         uint16_t to;
00115         uint16_t id;
00116         uint8_t type;           // DELUGE_PACKET_COMMAND
00117 } deluge_foot_command;
00118 
00119 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_HELLO 1
00120 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_STOPALL 3
00121 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_CLEARSTATS 2
00122 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_STARTRECORD 4
00123 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_ENDRECORD 5
00124 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_SENDSTATS 6
00125 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_SENDSTATS_REPLY 7
00126 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_FINISHED 8
00127 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_VERSION 9
00128 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_VERSION_REPLY 10
00129 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_NEIGHBORS 11
00130 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_NEIGHBORS_REPLY 12
00131 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_WIPE 13
00132 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_BOOT 14
00133 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_CACHESIZE 15
00134 #define DELUGE_COMMAND_POWER 16
00135 #endif

00137 /* Protocol footers: */
00138 
00139 /* All the footers end with a type field which can be checked like so:
00140  *      uint8_t type = packet->data[packet->size-1];
00141  * 
00142  * Footers use the 'packed' attribute for XMOS compatibility.
00143  */
00144 #define DELUGE_PACKET_SUMMARY   1
00145 #define DELUGE_PACKET_PROFILE   2
00146 #define DELUGE_PACKET_REQUEST   3
00147 #define DELUGE_PACKET_DATA              4
00148 #define DELUGE_PACKET_COMMAND   5
00149  
00150 typedef struct {
00151         //#ifdef DELUGE_SYMMETRIC_LINKS
00152         uint16_t neighbors[DELUGE_NEIGHBOR_COUNT];
00153         //#endif
00154         // The current image version number
00155         uint8_t version;
00156         // MEMBER:      Highest page available + 1
00157         // FORWARD:     Highest page available AT THE ROOT OF THE SPT + 1
00158         int8_t highPage;
00159         // MEMBER:      0
00160         // FORWARD:     Distance to root of the SPT
00161         uint8_t dtb;
00162         // ID of sender
00163         uint16_t id;
00164         uint8_t type;   // DELUGE_PACKET_SUMMARY
00165 } __attribute__ ((packed)) deluge_foot_summary;
00166 
00167 typedef struct {
00168         // Size in bytes of the current image
00169         uint32_t codeSize;
00170         // CRC of the whole image
00171         uint16_t crc;
00172         // Version number of the image
00173         uint8_t version;
00174         // Highest page in the image + 1
00175         int8_t goalPage;
00176         // ID of sender
00177         uint16_t id;
00178         uint8_t type;   // DELUGE_PACKET_PROFILE
00179 } __attribute__ ((packed)) deluge_foot_profile;
00180 
00181 typedef struct {
00182         // Bit vector indicating which packets of the page are needed
00183         uint16_t packets[3];
00184         // ID of the node this request is sent to
00185         uint16_t to;
00186         // Requested version
00187         uint8_t version;
00188         // Requested page
00189         int8_t page;
00190         // Amount to adjust transmit delay (see txDelay below)
00191         int8_t rateChange;
00192         // ID of sender
00193         uint16_t id;
00194         uint8_t type;   // DELUGE_PACKET_REQUEST
00195 } __attribute__ ((packed)) deluge_foot_request;
00196 
00197 // This footer follows DELUGE_PACKET_SIZE bytes of data
00198 typedef struct {
00199         uint8_t version;        // Version number
00200         int8_t page;            // Page number
00201         uint8_t packet;         // Packet number
00202         // ID of sender
00203         uint16_t id;
00204         uint8_t type;           // DELUGE_PACKET_DATA
00205 } __attribute__ ((packed)) deluge_foot_data;
00206 
00207 // -2 for net layer footer
00208 #define DELUGE_PACKET_SIZE (COM_DATA_SIZE-2-sizeof(deluge_foot_data))
00209 #define DELUGE_PACKETS_PER_PAGE         (48)
00210 // -2 for page CRC at the end of the last packet
00211 #define DELUGE_PAGE_SIZE (DELUGE_PACKETS_PER_PAGE * DELUGE_PACKET_SIZE - 2)
00212 #define DELUGE_ADDR(page, packet)       ((uint32_t)(page)*DELUGE_PAGE_SIZE + (packet)*DELUGE_PACKET_SIZE)
00213 
00214 /* Some of the Deluge state variables have different meanings depending on
00215  * which mode Deluge is running in.
00216  */
00217 
00218 #define DELUGE_STATE_MAINTAIN   1
00219 #define DELUGE_STATE_MAINTAIN2  2
00220 #define DELUGE_STATE_RX                 3
00221 #define DELUGE_STATE_TX                 4
00222 #define DELUGE_STATE_FORWARD    5
00223 // Don't change state if we see this
00224 #define DELUGE_STATE_IGNORE             6
00225 
00226 typedef struct
00227 {
00228         uint32_t codeSize;
00229         // CRC of the entire program
00230         uint16_t programcrc;
00231         // Bit vector of pages we need
00232         // There are enough bits here to cover 120 KB of flash
00233         // Only bits 0 through goalPage-1 are use, all others are ignored
00234         uint8_t pagesNeeded[6];
00235         // Version of the code image
00236         uint8_t version;
00237         // MEMBER:      Page we are currently receiving; equivalent to highPage
00238         // FORWARD:     Page we are currently caching
00239         int8_t incomingPage;
00240         // MEMBER:      Highest page available + 1; equivalent to incomingPage
00241         // FORWARD:     Highest page on the MEMBER node at the root of this SPT + 1
00242         int8_t highPage;
00243         // Highest page in the image + 1
00244         int8_t goalPage;
00245 } deluge_control_block;
00246 
00247 struct deluge_entry;
00248 
00249 typedef struct {
00250         // Persistent state; this is enough information to restart Deluge mid-update
00251         deluge_control_block dcb;
00252         
00253         // Protocol state; see the Deluge paper
00254         volatile uint8_t state;
00255         // Number of summaries overheard in this round
00256         volatile uint8_t nSummaries;
00257         // Number of profiles overheard in this round
00258         volatile uint8_t nProfiles;
00259         // TODO merge flags into a bit vector
00260         // Flag to start the next round with the minimum duration
00261         volatile uint8_t detectedInconsistency;
00262         // Flag to send a profile during the next round
00263         volatile uint8_t heardObsolete;
00264         // Someone else is requesting an update
00265         volatile uint8_t heardRequest;
00266         // Someone else is receiving an update
00267         volatile uint8_t heardData;
00268         // MEMBER:      Node to send request to in RX state
00269         // FORWARD:     Parent node in SPT
00270         volatile uint16_t updaterNode;
00271         // bit vector for packets we want
00272         uint16_t incomingPackets[3];
00273         // how many packets are we requesting
00274         uint8_t nPacketsRequested;
00275         // packets in our forwarding cache
00276         uint16_t cachedPackets[3];
00277         // CRC of the page we are currently receiving
00278         uint16_t incomingcrc;
00279         // Page that was requested from us
00280         volatile int8_t outgoingPage;
00281         // Bit vector of packets that were requested from us
00282         volatile uint16_t outgoingPackets[3];
00283         // Number of times our request has timed out
00284         uint8_t nRequests;
00285         // Listening time during the current MAINTAIN round before sending
00286         // a summary or profile
00287         uint32_t sumT;
00288         // Distance to root of the SPT via updaterNode
00289         // Summaries from farther nodes are ignored, unless requests to updaterNode
00290         // time out too many times, in which case dtb is set to its maximum.
00291         uint8_t dtb;
00292         
00293         // Number of milliseconds to sleep between packets in TX state
00294         volatile int32_t txDelay;
00295         // MEMBER:      The file containing the code image
00296         // FORWARD: The file caching the last page
00297         mos_file* image_file;
00298         // Why did we wake up?  Timeout or packet received?
00299         // TODO do we really need this?
00300         //volatile uint8_t wakeup_reason;
00301         // Prevents concurrent modification of Deluge state
00302         mos_mutex_t delugeLock;
00303         int8_t index;
00304 
00305         #ifdef DELUGE_SYMMETRIC_LINKS
00306         // Nodes we have heard from recently
00307         uint16_t neighbors[DELUGE_NEIGHBOR_COUNT];
00308         // DTBs we have found through symmetric links
00309         //uint8_t symdtbs[DELUGE_NEIGHBOR_COUNT];
00310         // Index into the array for storing the next neighbor we hear from
00311         uint8_t nextNeighbor;
00312         #endif
00313         
00314         #if DELUGE_CACHE_PAGES > 1
00315         // Page numbers of pages we have cached
00316         int8_t cache_map[DELUGE_CACHE_PAGES];
00317         // Cache page corresponding to outgoingPage
00318         int8_t outgoingCachePage;
00319         // Cache page corresponding to incomingPage
00320         int8_t incomingCachePage;
00321         // hack for testing cache sizes
00322         int8_t cacheSize;
00323         #endif
00324 } deluge_app;
00325 
00326 typedef struct deluge_entry
00327 {
00328         // Pointer to this instance's state
00329         deluge_app* app;
00330         // Tells dispatcher (see deluge_proto.c) that an event occurred in this
00331         // Deluge instance
00332         //sem app_sem;
00333         uint8_t copyState;
00334         // State to switch to when dispatchThread wakes up
00335         uint8_t nextState;
00336         // Implements timeouts
00337         mos_alarm_t alarm;
00338         // Duration of the current round of MAINTAIN state
00339         uint32_t roundT;
00340 } deluge_entry;
